subject: Mathematics - General Mathematics
11A07
68Q15
68Q17
90B99
creator: Fujimoto, Minoru
Uehara, Kunihiko
title: On NP complete problems I
description:
We study the quadratic residue problem known as an NP complete problem by way
of the prime number and show that a nondeterministic polynomial process does
not belong to the class P because of a random distribution of solutions for the
quadratic residue problem.

subject: Mathematics - General Mathematics
11M06, 11M26, 11B68
creator: Fujimoto, Minoru
Uehara, Kunihiko
title: A Brief note on the Riemann hypothesis
description:
We deal with the Euler's alternating series of the Riemann zeta function to
define a regularized ratio appeared in the functional equation even in the
critical strip and show some evidence to indicate the hypothesis in this note.
Comment: 4 pages; revised argument in Eq.(8), results unchanged

subject: Mathematics - General Mathematics
11M06, 11M26, 11B68
creator: Fujimoto, Minoru
Uehara, Kunihiko
title: A Brief Note on the Riemann hypothesis II
description:
We have dealt with the Euler's alternating series of the Riemann zeta
function to define a regularized ratio appeared in the functional equation even
in the critical strip and showed some evidence to indicate the hypothesis. We
briefly review the essential points and we also define a finite ratio in the
functional equation from divergent quantities in this note.

Comment: 8 pages, as the former paper "A brief note on the Riemann hypothesis"
  has been replaced, the summary and the appendix are added. Result unchanged

subject: Physics - General Physics
creator: Dey, Samrat
Swargiary, Devkant
Chakraborty, kishan
Dasgupta, Debasmita
Bordoloi, Darsana
Saikia, Rituja
Neog, Darsana
Shimray, Shishila
Paul, Supriyanka
Brahma, Kabita
Dey, Joydeep
Choudhury, Saurav
title: The confinement energy of quantum dots
description:
One of the most significant research interests in the field of electronics is
that on quantum dot, because such materials have electronic properties
intermediate between those of bulk semiconductors and those of discrete
molecules. Confinement energy is a very important property of quantum dot. In
this study, quantum confinement energy of a quantum dot is concluded to be
h2/8md2 (d being the diameter of the confinement) and not h2/8ma2 (a being the
radius of the confinement), as reported in the available literature. This is in
the light of a recent study [1]. This finding should have a significant impact
in the understanding of the physics of quantum dot and its technological
application.

subject: Physics - General Physics
creator: Dey, Samrat
Paul, Ashish
Saikia, Dipankar
Kalita, Deepjyoti
Debbarma, Anamika
Wahab, Shaheen Akhtar
Sarma, Saurabh
title: On static equilibrium and balance puzzler
description:
The principles of static equilibrium are of special interest to civil
engineers. For a rigid body to be in static equilibrium the condition is that
net force and net torque acting on the body should be zero. That clearly
signifies that if equal weights are placed on either sides of a balance, the
balance should be in equilibrium, even if its beam is not horizontal (we have
considered the beam to be straight and have no thickness, an ideal case). Thus,
although the weights are equal, they will appear different which is puzzling.
This also shows that the concept of equilibrium is confusing, especially
neutral equilibrium is confused to be stable equilibrium. The study not only
throws more light on the concept of static equilibrium, but also clarifies that
a structure need not be firm and steady even if it is in static equilibrium.
